lines.text: My own stools, Sir, are gigantic and have no more odor than a hot biscuit.
Oh, no, no, I can't eat fifteen gallons of yoghurt.
Oh, it's not going in that end, Mr. Lightbody.
An erection is a flagpole on your grave.
The fresh air, the exercise, and the pleasure of a leather saddle between one's thighs.
Why, Virginia, what do you mean?
Bicycle smile, I believe they call it.
You were masturbating!
I was not! I was massaging my colon!
Massaging your colon! I know where the colon is and it doesn't stick up in the air!
Sir, how often should one evacuate one's bowels?

One should never, ever, interrupt one's desire to defecate. I have inquired at the Bronx and London Zoos as to the daily bowel evacuations of primates. It is not once, twice, or three times, sir, but four. At the end of an average day, their cages are filled with a veritable mountain of natural health.
And, sex?
Sex is the sewer drain of a healthy body, sir! Any use of the sexual act other than procreation is a waste of vital energy! Wasted seeds are wasted lives!
Uh, eating meat?

"He that killeth the ox is as if he slew a man." Each juicy morsel of meat is alive, and swarming with the same filth as found in the carcass of a dead rat. Meat eaters, sir, are drowning in a tide of gore. What is a sausage? A sausage is an indigestible balloon of decayed beef, riddled with tuberculosis. Eat and die! For I have seen many a repentant meat glutton his body full of uric acid and remorse, his soul adrift on the raft in the ocean of poisonous slime, sloshin' against the walls of the body's kitchen.
Smoking?

The liver is the only thing standing between the smoker and death! Also certain other things have to be avoided... like, uh, feather beds, and romantic novels... and the, uh, touching of one's organs. Masturbation is the silent killer of the night! The vilest sin of self-pollution! It is the sin of Onan!
Uh, Dr. Kellogg, how did you come to invent the corn flake?
The corn flake, sir, is just one of my 75 creations for heathy livin', among them peanut butter and the electric blanket.
And what about your imitators? There are 103 other corn flakes presently being manufactured here in Battle Creek!
Sir, corn is the injuns gift to the new world, and the corn flake is my gift to the entire world.
And what do you think about your brother?

me, Dr. John Harvey Kellogg! Surgeon, inventor, author, and crusader for biological livin'! I do not seek monetary rewards, for I am called to a greater glory. Here at the Battle Creek Sanitarium, the spirits soar, the mind is educated, and the bowels - -the bowels are born again!
With friends like you, who needs enemas?
The doctor is a very great man.
He's a fuck pig! I hate him!
The enemas take some getting used to, but, in time, you'll learn to look forward to them like an old friend with a cold nose.
Do you masticate, Mr. Lightbody?
I wanted to be more than a hole in the mattress that answers to a name.
What would you like for dinner?
Toast.
And how would you like that, sir?
Toasted.
Build up your resolve, not your genitals!
[Poultney Dab collapses in the street in front of the San]
Poult, I believe you've suffered a heart attack.
[checks his pulse]
Worse, much worse, you're dead, sir. Could you have picked a better place to die, Poult? Instead of out here in the street in front of everybody? Some poster child for biological living you are!
[kicks him]
You hooked me like a fish, Bender. You scaled me, you gutted me, you stuffed me and fried me, chewed me up, swallowed me, and shat me out again!
[Charlie is waiting outside in the rain for Bender. A kid approaches him]
You Charlie Ossining?
Yes.
Mr. Bender says you're to come with me.
Good God boy, where's the cab?
No cab, Mr. Bender says to walk.
Is it far?
It wouldn't be if we weren't walking.
Health! The 'open sesame' to the sucker's purse!
Marriage is just legalized prostitution, my dear.
They're dead! They've been electrocuted!
Rather a severe cure for flatulence, I do admit.
